result.execSummary:
The defendant Cleon Andre Mixon was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Penalties for Misdemeanors-Class "B"], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Order for payment on July 25, 2016 at 01:30 pm.

CO: RMW, REP: Drost, CLERK: Liddle. ADA:  Michael Edward Nieskes   DF ATTY:  Tyler Brennan   DF:  Cleon Andre Mixon appeared. Case called at 8:22 a.m. Court notes this is the date and time for a pre trial conference. ADA Nieskes states there is a resolution and recites agreement. State is in compliance with Victims rights. Atty Brennan in agreement.   Court reads charge and maximum penalty. DE pleads GUILTY to amended Ct 1 DC without domestic abuse enhancer in 15CM758 . DE sworn. Crt reviews plea questionnaire and informs DE of rights. Crt finds DE freely, voluntarily and knowingly waives rights and makes plea. Attorney's stipulate to the facts. Crt accepts plea, finds factual basis and finds DE guilty of amended Ct 1 Disorderly Conduct without the domestic abuse enhancer in 15CM758. DE makes statement. Sentencing arguments. 20 days to appeal.  

Crt orders:

- 2 days jail. 2 days credit. TIME SERVED

- Court costs $243.00. 60 days to pay.

- DNA Surcharge $200.00

- DNA Sample

Pre-trial conference at 02-08-2016 02:00 pm

It is hereby ordered, as a condition of the defendant's bond/bail in the above-captioned case, that he/she have absolutely NO CONTACT whatsoever with the complaining witness, or with any of the following named persons and/or locations, Anissa B.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as no contact in person, by telephone, by way of electronic device, email, facsimile, social media including but not limited to texting, Facebook, Twitter, contact through the mail, and/or through a third person.  The aforementioned condition of bond/bail is set pursuant to Sec. 969.02(3)(d), Wis Stats.

Defendant may collect his belongings from the residence with a Uniformed Officer.

Further, it is ORDERED that if the defendant fails to comply with the conditions of his/her bond/bail that he/she may be charged with the offense of bailjumping contrary to Sec. 946.49(1)(a), Wis. Stats.
Defendant appeared via video conferencing from the St Croix County jail.

CO: RMW, RPR: Erin Drost, CLERK: E. Ferrill, ADA:   Megan E. Kelly   DF ATTY:  Joseph R. Caton   DF:  Cleon Andre Mixon appeared from jail via video. Court confirms address.   Court informs def of charges, possible penalties and rights. Def understands.  Waives reading.  NG.  Waives speedy trial. ADA Kelly is requesting a low cash bond, Atty Caton argues.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for February 8, 2016 at 02:00 pm.
